com.objetdirect.tatami.client.dnd
Class DnD

java.lang.Object
  com.objetdirect.tatami.client.dnd.DnD

public class DnD
extends java.lang.Object

Author:
rdunklau This class is a Helper for using Drag and Drop interface. The method presented here should be sufficient for most usages.

Method Detail

registerTreeSource

public static TreeSource registerTreeSource(Tree tree)
Registers a tree as a "TreeSource". That mean each of the TreeItems can be dragged from the tree.

Parameters:
tree - the tree to register
Returns:
an object representing the DnDSource which has been registered

unregisterSource

public static TreeSource unregisterSource(Tree tree)
Unregisters a tree as a "TreeSource". Thant mean the TreeItems in the tree won't be draggable anymore

Parameters:
tree - a registered tree
Returns:
an object representing the DnDSource which has been unregistered

registerSource

public static WidgetSource registerSource(com.google.gwt.user.client.ui.Panel panel)
Registers a Panel as a WidgetSource. A WidgetSource contains draggable widgets

Parameters:
panel - the panel to be registered as a widget source
Returns:
an object representing the DnDSource which has been registered

unregisterSource

Unregisters a panel as a Widget Source. That means its Element will not be draggable anymore.

Parameters:
panel - : a registered panel source
Returns:
an object representing the DnDSource which has been unregistered

registerTarget

public static WidgetTarget registerTarget(com.google.gwt.user.client.ui.Widget widget)
Registers a panel as a WidgetTarget. A widget target may accept dropped elements. If it is already registered as a source, the "target" behavior will be triggered on the very same WidgetSource object.

Parameters:
panel - : the panel to register as a Target.
Returns:

Registers a tree as target, allowing it to receive dropped elements.

Returns:

Unregister a target, which will not accept dropped elements anymore.

Parameters:

Returns:

registerBehavior

public static <E extends IDnDElement,S extends IDnDSource<? super E>,T extends IDnDTarget> void registerBehavior(IDnDBehavior<E,S,T> behavior,
                                                                                                                 com.google.gwt.user.client.ui.Widget source,
                                                                                                                 com.google.gwt.user.client.ui.Widget target)
                             throws DnDBehaviors.BehaviorScopeException
Register the given behavior for dnd operations from the source to the target. When the source is null, the behavior is registered for dnd operations from any source to the target When the target is null, the behavior is registered for dnd operations from the source to any target When both source and target are null, the behavior is registered for dnd operations from any source to any target If such an imprecise behavior is registered, it will be overridden by any more precise behavior. If a behavior is registered, another behavior cannot be added to the same "source-target" couple.

Type Parameters:
E - : A type of IDnDElement which is handled by both the source and the Behavior
S - : A type of IDnDSource which handles IDnDElements of type , and is handled by the behavior
T - : A type of Target which is handled by the Behavior
Parameters:
behavior - : a behavior managing Elements from type , Sources from type , and Targets from type
source - : a widget which is registered as source (it can be wether a Tree registered as a TreeSource, or a Panel registered as a WidgetSource, or null
target - :a widget which is registered as target, or null
Throws:
DnDBehaviors.BehaviorScopeException - : when a behavior is already registered for this source-target couple

registerBehaviorForDnDObjects

public static <E extends IDnDElement,S extends IDnDSource<? super E>,T extends IDnDTarget> void registerBehaviorForDnDObjects(IDnDBehavior<E,S,T> behavior,
                                                                                                                              S source,
                                                                                                                              T target)
                                          throws DnDBehaviors.BehaviorScopeException
Register the given behavior for dnd operations from the source to the target. When the source is null, the behavior is registered for dnd operations from any source to the target When the target is null, the behavior is registered for dnd operations from the source to any target When both source and target are null, the behavior is registered for dnd operations from any source to any target If such an imprecise behavior is registered, it will be overridden by any more precise behavior. If a behavior is registered, another behavior cannot be added to the same "source-target" couple.

Type Parameters:
E - : A type of IDnDElement which is handled by both the source and the Behavior
S - : A type of IDnDSource which handles IDnDElements of type , and is handled by the behavior
T - : A type of Target which is handled by the Behavior
Parameters:
behavior - : a behavior managing Elements from type , Sources from type , and Targets from type
source - : a dnd source
target - :a dnd target
Throws:
DnDBehaviors.BehaviorScopeException - : when a behavior is already registered for this source-target couple

move

public static void move(com.google.gwt.user.client.ui.Widget widget,
                        com.google.gwt.user.client.ui.Panel panelsrc,
                        com.google.gwt.user.client.ui.Panel paneldst)
Helper method designed to move a draggable element from a source panel to a target panel (or another source panel)

Parameters:
widget - : widget to move from a panel to another
panelsrc - : the origin panel
paneldst - : the destination panel

getWidgetUnderDrop

public static com.google.gwt.user.client.ui.Widget getWidgetUnderDrop(java.lang.String targetNodeId,
                                                                      com.google.gwt.user.client.ui.Panel target)
Helper method used to retrieve the deepest widget which was under the drop.

Parameters:
targetNodeId - : the targetNodeId, usually a DOM id. It is the same as given in @link WidgetDnDBehavior
target - : the target in which the target node should be located
Returns:
the widget which was under the drop, within the Target.

setId

public static java.lang.String setId(com.google.gwt.user.client.ui.Widget widget)
Assign a random but unique id to a widget. A widget without an id cannot be located within a target

Parameters:
widget -
Returns:
the generated id.
